 31 -def ConvertToPyMoBu(component): 

 32      '''Utility to convert a FB class to a PMB class''' 
 33      if isinstance(component, PMBComponent): 
 34          return component 
 35       
 36      # get the first two inherited classes 
 37      componentClasses = component.__class__.__mro__ 
 38       
 39      for fbClass in componentClasses: 
 40          pmbClassName = fbClass.__name__.replace('FB', 'PMB') 
 41       
 42          try: 
 43              pmbClass = eval(pmbClassName) 
 44          except: 
 45              continue 
 46           
 47          return pmbClass.Convert(component) 

 48       
 49  # add this function to FBComponent 
 50  FBComponent.ConvertToPyMoBu = ConvertToPyMoBu     

 51

 88 -    def Convert(cls, component):

 91 -    def ListProperties(self, pattern=None, type=None, **kwargs): 

 92          ''' 
 93          Returns a list of property names from the PropertyList with optional filters 
 94          @param pattern: list properties with specific names with optional wildcard *. Default is all. 
 95          @param type: get properties of specific types. See self.kPropertyTypes.keys() for names 
 96           
 97          Optional parameters True/False for testing from FBProperty: 
 98          IsAnimatable 
 99          IsInternal 
100          IsList 
101          IsMaxClamp 
102          IsMinClamp 
103          IsObjectList 
104          IsReadOnly 
105          IsReferenceProperty 
106          IsUserProperty 
107          ''' 
108          # setup a test for the optional parameters 
109          def passesOptionalTest(x): 
110              for arg, challenge in kwargs.iteritems(): 
111                  func = getattr(x, arg, None) 
112                  if func and func() != challenge: 
113                      return False 
114              return True 

115               
116          # set up the name testing based on the pattern 
117          if pattern:            
118              # if there is a wild card in the pattern 
119              if '*' in pattern: 
120                  pattern = pattern.replace('*', '.*') 
121                  # name testing function 
122                  passesNameTest = lambda x: re.match(pattern, x.GetName()) 
123              else: 
124                  passesNameTest = lambda x: pattern == x.GetName()       
125          else: 
126              passesNameTest = lambda x: True 
127           
128          # add type testing 
129          if type: 
130              propertyType = self.kPropertyTypes[type][0] 
131              passesTypeTest = lambda x: x.GetPropertyType() == propertyType 
132          else: 
133              passesTypeTest = lambda x: True 
134               
135          properties = [] 
136          for p in self.component.PropertyList: 
137              # odd bug that some items are None 
138              if p is None: 
139                  continue 
140               
141              if not passesOptionalTest(p): 
142                  continue 
143               
144              if not passesTypeTest(p): 
145                  continue 
146               
147              if passesNameTest(p): 
148                  properties.append(p) 
149           
150          return properties 

151       

152 -    def GetPropertyValue(self, name): 

153          '''Returns a property value from the components PropertyList''' 
154          return self._findProperty(name).Data 

155           

156 -    def SetPropertyValue(self, name, value): 

157          '''Sets a property value in the components PropertyList''' 
158          self._findProperty(name).Data = value 

159           

160 -    def AddProperty(self, name, type, animatable=True, user=True): 

161          ''' 
162          Add a property to this component 
163          @param name: the name of the property 
164          @param type: the data type of the property:    
165          ''' 
166           
167          if self.ListProperties(pattern=name): 
168              raise Exception("Can not add property '%s'. Already exists on object '%'" % (name, self)) 
169          try: 
170              typeData = self.kPropertyTypes[type] 
171          except KeyError: 
172              raise Exception("Invalid property type '%s'. Valid types are: '%s'" % (type, ', '.join(self.kPropertyTypes.keys()))) 
173           
174          typeData.extend([animatable, user, None]) 
175           
176          self.component.PropertyCreate(name, *typeData) 

177       

178 -    def RemoveProperty(self, name): 

179          '''Remove a property from an object''' 
180          property = self._findProperty(name) 
181  # test is we can remove a non-user property or not 
182          if property.IsUserProperty(): 
183              self.component.PropertyRemove(property) 
184          else: 
185              raise Exception("Property is flagged as non-user. Unable to remove property '%s' from object '%s'" % (name, self)) 

186       

187 -    def _findProperty(self, name): 

188          # similar to the native way but raises and exception if property isn't found 
189          property = self.component.PropertyList.Find(name) 
190          if property: 
191              return property 
192          else: 
193              raise Exception("Could not find property named '%s' for object '%s'" % (name, self)) 

194       

195 -    def GetNamespace(self): 

196          '''Returns the namespace of the object''' 
197          namespace = re.match(".*:", getattr(self.component, 'LongName', self.component.Name)) 
198          if namespace: 
199              return namespace.group() 

200       

201 -    def AddNamespace(self, namespace, hierarchy=True, toRight=False): 

202          ''' 
203          Adds a namespace to the object 
204          @param hierarchy: Apply this action to hierarchy. Default True 
205          @param toRight: Add namespace to the right of other namespaces. Default False (left) 
206          ''' 
207          from pyfbsdk import FBConstraint 
208          action = FBNamespaceAction.kFBConcatNamespace 
209          if hierarchy and not isinstance(self.component, FBConstraint): 
210              self.component.ProcessNamespaceHierarchy(action, namespace, None, toRight) 
211          else: 
212              self.component.ProcessObjectNamespace(action, namespace, None, toRight) 

213               

214 -    def SwapNamespace(self, newNamespace, oldNamespace, hierarchy=True): 

215          ''' 
216          Swaps a new namespace with an existing namespace 
217          @param hierarchy: Apply this action to hierarchy. Default True 
218          ''' 
219          from pyfbsdk import FBConstraint 
220          action = FBNamespaceAction.kFBReplaceNamespace 
221          if hierarchy and not isinstance(self.component, FBConstraint): 
222              self.component.ProcessNamespaceHierarchy(action, newNamespace, oldNamespace) 
223          else: 
224              self.component.ProcessObjectNamespace(action, newNamespace, oldNamespace) 

225       

226 -    def StripNamespace(self, hierarchy=True): 

227          ''' 
228          Removes all the namespaces 
229          @param hierarchy: Apply this action to hierarchy. Default True  
230          ''' 
231          from pyfbsdk import FBConstraint 
232          action = FBNamespaceAction.kFBRemoveAllNamespace 
233          if hierarchy and not isinstance(self.component, FBConstraint): 
234              self.component.ProcessNamespaceHierarchy(action, '') 
235          else: 
236              self.component.ProcessObjectNamespace(action, '')

258 -    def SetInverseMatrix(self, matrix, worldSpace=False, type='Transformation'):

263          ''' 
264          try: 
265              self.component.SetMatrix(matrix, self.kInverseMatrixTypeDict[type], worldSpace) 
266          except KeyError:
